wordpressWpDailyReads.title: Daily Reads 8/12/2019
wordpressWpDailyReads.content:
Happy Monday, everyone. We start the week by checking in on the treasury yield as it falls below 1.7%.Hong Kong airport cancels flights amid protestors raiding the main terminal building.BlackRock made a $875 million investment in Sports Illustrated, becoming its largest shareholder.Check out our featured article on retirement. Regardless of age, start educating yourself about what you’ll need for a comfortable retirement. And we might brag about how busy we are, but consider the significance that comes with the power to not be busy, and how you should be rethinking how you spend your time.

 

MARKETS

10-year Treasury yield falls below 1.7% amid trade, global growth worries

U.S. government debt yields were sharply lower Monday morning, amid trade tensions between the world’s two largest economies and concerns of slowing global economic growth.

 

BUSINESS

Hong Kong Cancels All Remaining Monday Flights as Protests Swarm Airport

Hong Kong airport authorities canceled remaining flights on Monday after protesters swarmed the main terminal building for a fourth day, the biggest disruption yet to the city’s economy since demonstrations began in early June.

 

Sports Illustrated, Juicy Couture and dozens of brands get $875 million from BlackRock

BlackRock made a big $875 million investment and became the largest shareholder of a company that owns Sports Illustrated, Nine West, Juicy Couture and dozens of other brands.

 

RETIREMENT

It’s Monday Again…..When Is My Retirement?

Saving for retirement isn’t easy, neither is living your golden years without enough money. Make the right choice. Start by reading this week’s terrific links.

 

PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT

The power of doing nothing at all

We’ve grown to subconsciously measure a person’s worth based off how many hours they work, how much is on their plate and put simply
